intro: Lambertia formosa var. pallida, commonly known as the white-flowered lambertia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has woody stems and produces clusters of small, showy inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
